goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by population?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of state capitals by population
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of population sizes of state capitals and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the population and area of state capitals?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of state capitals by population and area
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between the population and area of state capitals.

goals.question: What is the most common first letter of state capitals?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the count of state capitals by first letter
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any patterns or trends in the naming of state capitals.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by longitude?
goals.visualization: Histogram of state capitals by longitude
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of state capitals across the United States and identify any clusters.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by region?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of state capitals by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of state capitals across the different regions of the United States.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='population', ascending=False)
    plt.bar(data['city'], data['population'])
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by population?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.scatter(data['population'], data['area'], alpha=0.5)
    ax.set_xlabel('Population')
    ax.set_ylabel('Area')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the population and area of state capitals?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['first_letter'] = data['capital'].str[0]
    letter_counts = data['first_letter'].value_counts()
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(letter_counts.index, letter_counts.values)
    ax.set_xlabel('First Letter')
    ax.set_ylabel('Count')
    ax.axhline(y=letter_counts.max(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Most common letter: {letter_counts.idxmax()} ({letter_counts.max():.2f})')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the most common first letter of state capitals?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.hist(data['longitude'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.5)
    ax.axvline(data['longitude'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f'Mean: {data["longitude"].mean():.2f}')
    ax.axvline(data['longitude'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f'Median: {data["longitude"].median():.2f}')
    ax.set_xlabel('Longitude')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by longitude?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    regions = data.groupby('region').size()
    plt.pie(regions, labels=regions.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by region?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
